cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi S of Mobile Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: slowly north-northeast, landfall along the AL/FL border then tracking inland across SE Alabama and central Georgia toward South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama–Florida border (around Gulf Shores–Pensacola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch and Tropical Storm Watch confined to the central-eastern Gulf Coast; none issued for Georgia coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from east of Bay St. Louis MS to Navarre FL; Tropical Storm Warning east of Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL and westward to Grand Isle LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast (LA, MS, AL, FL Panhandle) with inland impacts spreading across AL and GA into the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to gale force possible Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises (generally <3 ft) possible along the southeast Georgia coast mainly with onshore flow Thursday–Friday
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from Sally could bring 2–4 in., locally higher to around 4–6 in. if the core rain shield expands eastward Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands across southeast Georgia late Wednesday night and Thursday
